holidays.name: Tick Tock Day
holidays.description: A quirky reminder that the year is running out and those last-minute goals and resolutions should get going! It‚Äôs perfect for urging procrastinators to finally stop putting things off before the calendar flips.
holidays.origin: Observed unofficially to motivate people to take action on their year's pending goals, emerging as a popular internet meme and social media prompt.
holidays.funFact: Tick Tock Day gained traction through viral posts urging people to 'get a move on' before the year ends, making it a favorite among last-minute planners.

holidays.name: Card Playing Day
holidays.description: Dedicated to the timeless joy of playing cards‚Äîwhether it's poker, bridge, solitaire, or any other card game. A great day to shuffle, deal, and enjoy some friendly competition!
holidays.origin: Unofficial observance to celebrate the social and entertainment value of card games, with roots in various traditional games worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Card games date back over 1,000 years, originating in China before spreading globally, and December 29 is the perfect chill day for indoor games.

holidays.name: Chilean Sheep Shearing Festival
holidays.description: A traditional Chilean celebration marking the annual shearing of sheep, highlighting the cultural and economic importance of wool farming in rural communities.
holidays.origin: Local festival turned cultural event celebrated mainly in southern Chile during late December, showcasing sheep shearing competitions and folk music.
holidays.funFact: Some communities hold lively sheep-shearing contests on this day, drawing crowds and emphasizing sustainable wool practices.

holidays.name: Bacon Day
holidays.description: An unofficial but beloved food holiday honoring everyone's favorite crispy, savory treat. Perfect for indulging in bacon-wrapped anything and celebrating this breakfast staple.
holidays.origin: Pop culture food holiday created by bacon enthusiasts and social media foodies to celebrate bacon's versatility and popularity.
holidays.funFact: Bacon Day sparks a surge in creative recipes from bacon-wrapped desserts to bacon cocktails, fueling a meaty frenzy online.
